main event: An unidentified luminous object was observed in the Gulf of Mexico on June 20, 1963.
interesting points: The object appeared as bright as Polaris and was flying at an elevation of 18 degrees., It was observed at a 340-degree azimuth., The light disappeared at an altitude of approximately 65 minutes after being spotted., The object was speculated to be a balloon or possibly an aircraft., Observations included ground-radar and visual confirmation.
witness description: Civilian observation reported through radar and visual methods.
